conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the copper rod MN in the presence of the magnetic field.
The key forces are the gravitational force and the magnetic force.
The copper rod MN is horizontally suspended in a uniform magnetic field with a magnetic induction intensity of B.
The direction of the magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the paper (into the paper).
The gravitational force acting on the rod is F_g = mg.
The magnetic force acting on the rod is F_B = BIL.
When the rod is not energized, the tension in each wire is T_0 = mg/2.
When the rod is energized, the tension in each wire is T = mg/8.
The total tension in the wires when energized is 2T = mg/4.
The magnetic force must balance the difference between the gravitational force and the total tension in the wires: BIL = 3mg/4.
Solve for the current I: I = 3mg/(4BL).
Determine the direction of the current using the right-hand rule: the current is from M to N.
The magnitude of the current in the rod is 3mg/(4BL) and the direction is from M to N.
